description: The MPU‑6000/MPU‑6050 is a 6‑axis motion‑tracking device that integrates a 3‑axis MEMS gyroscope, a 3‑axis MEMS accelerometer, and an on‑chip Digital Motion Processor (DMP) in a 4 × 4 × 0.9 mm QFN package. It supports I²C (400 kHz) and, for the MPU‑6000, SPI (1 MHz) interfaces, and offers programmable full‑scale ranges, low‑power modes, and a 1024‑byte FIFO buffer.
application_examples: Gesture recognition in smartphones and tablets
related_products: MPU‑6050 with external magnetometer via auxiliary I²C

specifications.sensor_type: 3‑axis MEMS gyroscope + 3‑axis MEMS accelerometer + on‑chip DMP
specifications.measuring_range: Gyroscope: ±250, ±500, ±1000, ±2000 °/s; Accelerometer: ±2 g, ±4 g, ±8 g, ±16 g
specifications.resolution: 16‑bit ADC for both gyro and accel
specifications.operating_voltage: 2.375 V – 3.46 V (VDD); VLOGIC 1.71 V – VDD for MPU‑6050
specifications.current_consumption: Normal: 3.9 mA (gyro + accel + DMP); Gyro only: 3.6 mA; Accel only: 500 µA; Low‑power accel: 10 µA (1.25 Hz) – 140 µA (40 Hz)
specifications.interface: I²C (400 kHz) and SPI (1 MHz, MPU‑6000 only)
other: Digital Motion Processor (DMP) for motion fusion
Programmable low‑pass filters for gyro, accel, and temp
Self‑test capability for gyro and accel

pins.Other: /CS (SPI chip select), VLOGIC (MPU‑6050 only), AD0/SDO (I²C address LSB), FSYNC, INT, AUX_DA, AUX_CL, CLKIN, REGOUT, CPOUT, C3, C1, C2, C4 (capacitors)

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VDD to 2.375–3.46 V, GND to ground, SDA to I²C data line, SCL to I²C clock line, AD0 to set I²C address (0 or 1). For MPU‑6050, also connect VLOGIC to 1.71 V–VDD. Pull‑up resistors on SDA/SCL to VDD. For SPI (MPU‑6000), connect /CS low, SCLK, SDI, SDO, and optionally pull‑ups on I²C lines if using auxiliary bus.

example_code.explaination: Basic Arduino sketch that wakes the MPU‑6050, reads 14 bytes of sensor data (3‑axis accel, 3‑axis gyro, temp), and prints them to the serial monitor.
